intro: Gustavia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and prominent stamens, and bloom during the rainy season. Gustavia angustifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to coastal and tropical environments.
